title: invalid vobject. document ended prematurely.
body:
hi,

i've just installed owncloud 5.0.5 and am in the middle of testing the calendar functionality. i'm having some problems with syncing between devices. the last incident was with my ipad running ios 6.1.3.

what happens i created a new meeting but for some reason the entire calendardata field for an entry in oc_calendar_objects was not inserted properly. i then had the entry on the ipad and a incorrect entry in the owncloud database. since the entry in de database is incorrect it no longer updates all the other devices. 

i discovered the problem when trying to download the readonly version of de calendar. it then throws an xml error stating the error 'document ended prematurely'. if i go in the database and look into oc_calendar_objects (since i have few entries and still testing) i could spot the calendardata field for the broken entry cut off at the summary and missing the end tags (still don't know why it happened)

if i delete the error entry and try to download the readonly ics file again it works again. all the other changes done to the other entries are then resynced again between owncloud and the ios devices.

is it possible to try and incorporate error checking and handling for this? right now one broken object entry breaks syncing the changes of all the other entries in the same calendar.

kind regards,

ton
